newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel oil ticks up, business thin.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel oil ticks up, business thin.

text.p: NWE low sulphur straight-run offer levels picked up slightly on Monday on the back of last week's late deals, stronger crude and opening gambits by sellers, traders said.
Offer levels were $96 fob or higher. Bids were not loudly spoken with many buyers appearing willing to wait until the cargoes in the offing become imminent.
Although Brent futures have picked up, refiners appear not yet willing to make space in their plants to run much straight-run, sellers said.

Traders said the most obvious home for the material was still the United States. Around 200,000 tonnes is believed to have headed trans-atlantic in the last 10 days. - London newsroom +44 171 542 8060
